DTrackSDK.cpp

00001 /* DTrackSDK: C++ source file, A.R.T. GmbH 3.5.07-27.01.12
00002  *
00003  * DTrackSDK: functions to receive and process DTrack UDP packets (ASCII protocol), as
00004  * well as to exchange DTrack2 TCP command strings.
00005  * Copyright (C) 2007-2012, Advanced Realtime Tracking GmbH
00006  *
00007  * This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
00008  * modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
00009  * License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
00010  * version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
00011  *
00012  * This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00013  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00014  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
00015  * Lesser General Public License for more details.
00016  *
00017  * You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public
00018  * License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software
00019  * Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA
00020  *
00021  *
00022  * Version v2.2.0
00023  *
00024  * Purpose:
00025  *  - receives DTrack UDP packets (ASCII protocol) and converts them into easier to handle data
00026  *  - sends and receives DTrack2 commands (TCP)
00027  *  - DTrack2 network protocol due to: 'Technical Appendix DTrack v2.0'
00028  *  - for ARTtrack Controller versions v0.2 (and compatible versions)
00029  *  - tested under Linux (gcc) and MS Windows 2000/XP (MS Visual C++)
00030  *
00031  * $Id: DTrackSDK.cpp,v 1.40 2012/01/20 14:32:04 christoph Exp $
00032  */

00048 DTrackSDK::DTrackSDK(unsigned short data_port) {
00049         init("", 0, data_port, SYS_DTRACK_UNKNOWN);

00061         init(server_host, 50105, data_port, SYS_DTRACK_2);
00062 }

00091 DTrackSDK::DTrackSDK(const std::string server_host,     unsigned short server_port,     unsigned short data_port,
00092         RemoteSystemType remote_type, int data_bufsize, int data_timeout_us, int srv_timeout_us)

00097 
00109 void DTrackSDK::init(const std::string server_host,     unsigned short server_port,     unsigned short data_port,
00110         RemoteSystemType remote_type, int data_bufsize, int data_timeout_us, int srv_timeout_us)
00111 {
00112         rsType = remote_type;
00113         int err;
00114 
00115         d_udpsock = NULL;
00116         d_tcpsock = NULL;
00117         d_udpbuf = NULL;
00118 
00119         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00120         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
00121         setLastDTrackError();
00122 
00123         d_udptimeout_us = data_timeout_us;
00124         d_tcptimeout_us = srv_timeout_us;
00125         d_remoteport = server_port;
00126 
00127         net_init();
00128 
00129         // parse remote address if available
00130         d_remote_ip = 0;
00131         if (!server_host.empty()) {
00132                 d_remote_ip = ip_name2ip(server_host.c_str());
00133         }
00134 
00135         // create UDP socket:
00136         d_udpport = data_port;
00137 
00138         if ((d_remote_ip != 0) && (server_port == 0)) { // listen to multicast case
00139                 err = udp_init(&d_udpsock, &d_udpport, d_remote_ip);
00140         } else { // normal case
00141                 err = udp_init(&d_udpsock, &d_udpport);
00142         }
00143         if (err) {
00144                 d_udpsock = NULL;
00145                 d_udpport = 0;
00146                 return;
00147         }
00148 
00149         // create UDP buffer:
00150         d_udpbufsize = data_bufsize;
00151         d_udpbuf = (char *)malloc(data_bufsize);
00152         if (!d_udpbuf) {
00153                 udp_exit(d_udpsock);
00154                 d_udpsock = NULL;
00155                 d_udpport = 0;
00156                 return;
00157         }
00158 
00159         if (d_remote_ip) {
00160                 if (server_port == 0) { // multicast
00161                         d_remoteport = 0;
00162                 } else {
00163                         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK) {
00164                                 err = tcp_client_init(&d_tcpsock, d_remote_ip, server_port);
00165                                 if (err) {  // no connection to DTrack2 server
00166                                         // on error assuming DTrack if system is unknown
00167                                         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK_UNKNOWN)
00168                                         {
00169                                                 rsType = SYS_DTRACK;
00170                                                 // DTrack will not listen to tcp port 50105 -> ignore tcp connection
00171                                         }
00172                                 } else {
00173                                         // TCP connection up, should be DTrack2
00174                                         rsType = SYS_DTRACK_2;
00175                                 }
00176                         }
00177                 }
00178         }
00179         // reset actual DTrack data:
00180         act_framecounter = 0;
00181         act_timestamp = -1;
00182 
00183         act_num_body = act_num_flystick = act_num_meatool = act_num_mearef = act_num_hand = act_num_human = 0;
00184         act_num_marker = 0;
00185 
00186         d_message_origin = "";
00187         d_message_status = "";
00188         d_message_framenr = 0;
00189         d_message_errorid = 0;
00190         d_message_msg = "";
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00197 DTrackSDK::~DTrackSDK()
00198 {
00199         // release buffer
00200         free(d_udpbuf);
00201 
00202         // release sockets & net
00203         if ((d_remote_ip != 0) && (d_remoteport == 0)) {
00204                 udp_exit(d_udpsock, d_remote_ip);
00205         } else {
00206                 udp_exit(d_udpsock);
00207         }
00208         tcp_exit(d_tcpsock);
00209         net_exit();
00210 }

00219 bool DTrackSDK::setDataTimeoutUS(int timeout) {
00220         if (timeout < 1)
00221                 return false;
00222         d_udptimeout_us = timeout;
00223         return true;
00224 }

00233 bool DTrackSDK::setControllerTimeoutUS(int timeout) {
00234         if (timeout < 1)
00235                 return false;
00236         d_tcptimeout_us = timeout;
00237         return true;
00238 }

00316 bool DTrackSDK::isLocalDataPortValid()
00317 {
00318         return (d_udpsock != NULL);
00319 }

00321 
00328 bool DTrackSDK::isCommandInterfaceValid()
00329 {
00330         return (d_tcpsock != NULL);

00332 
00333 
00340 bool DTrackSDK::receive()
00341 {
00342         char* s;
00343         int i, j, k, l, n, len, id;
00344         char sfmt[20];
00345         int iarr[5];
00346         double d, darr[6];
00347         int loc_num_bodycal, loc_num_handcal, loc_num_flystick1, loc_num_meatool;
00348 
00349         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00350         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
00351 
00352         if (!isLocalDataPortValid()) {
00353                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
00354                 return false;
00355         }
00356         // defaults:
00357         act_framecounter = 0;
00358         act_timestamp = -1;   // i.e. not available
00359         loc_num_bodycal = loc_num_handcal = -1;  // i.e. not available
00360         loc_num_flystick1 = loc_num_meatool = 0;
00361 
00362         // receive UDP packet:
00363         len = udp_receive(d_udpsock, d_udpbuf, d_udpbufsize-1, d_udptimeout_us);
00364         if (len == -1) {
00365                 lastDataError = ERR_TIMEOUT;
00366                 return false;
00367         }
00368 
00369         if (len <= 0) {
00370                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
00371                 return false;
00372         }
00373 
00374         s = d_udpbuf;
00375         s[len] = '\0';
00376 
00377         // process lines:
00378         lastDataError = ERR_PARSE;
00379 
00380         do {
00381                 // line for frame counter:
00382                 if (!strncmp(s, "fr ", 3)) {
00383                         s += 3;
00384                         if (!(s = string_get_ui(s, &act_framecounter))) {
00385                                 act_framecounter = 0;
00386                                 return false;
00387                         }
00388                         continue;
00389                 }
00390                 // line for timestamp:
00391                 if (!strncmp(s, "ts ", 3)) {
00392                         s += 3;
00393                         if (!(s = string_get_d(s, &act_timestamp)))     {
00394                                 act_timestamp = -1;
00395                                 return false;
00396                         }
00397                         continue;
00398                 }
00399                 // line for additional information about number of calibrated bodies:
00400                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dcal ", 6)) {
00401                         s += 6;
00402                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &loc_num_bodycal))) {
00403                                 return false;
00404                         }
00405                         continue;
00406                 }
00407                 // line for standard body data:
00408                 if (!strncmp(s, "6d ", 3)) {
00409                         s += 3;
00410                         // disable all existing dataargc != 2
00411                         for (i=0; i<act_num_body; i++) {
00412                                 memset(&act_body[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00413                                 act_body[i].id = i;
00414                                 act_body[i].quality = -1;
00415                         }
00416                         // get number of standard bodies (in line)
00417                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00418                                 return false;
00419                         }
00420                         // get data of standard bodies
00421                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00422                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &id, NULL, &d))) {
00423                                         return false;
00424                                 }
00425                                 // adjust length of vector
00426                                 if (id >= act_num_body) {
00427                                         act_body.resize(id + 1);
00428                                         for (j = act_num_body; j<=id; j++) {
00429                                                 memset(&act_body[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00430                                                 act_body[j].id = j;
00431                                                 act_body[j].quality = -1;
00432                                         }
00433                                         act_num_body = id + 1;
00434                                 }
00435                                 act_body[id].id = id;
00436                                 act_body[id].quality = d;
00437                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_body[id].loc))) {
00438                                         return false;
00439                                 }
00440                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_body[id].rot))) {
00441                                         return false;
00442                                 }
00443                         }
00444                         continue;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 // line for Flystick data (older format):
00448                 if (!strncmp(s, "6df ", 4)) {
00449                         s += 4;
00450                         // get number of calibrated Flysticks
00451                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00452                                 return false;
00453                         }
00454                         loc_num_flystick1 = n;
00455                         // adjust length of vector
00456                         if (n != act_num_flystick) {
00457                                 act_flystick.resize(n);
00458                                 act_num_flystick = n;
00459                         }
00460                         // get data of Flysticks
00461                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00462                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idi", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00463                                         return false;
00464                                 }
00465                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {     // not expected
00466                                         return false;
00467                                 }
00468                                 act_flystick[i].id = iarr[0];
00469                                 act_flystick[i].quality = d;
00470                                 act_flystick[i].num_button = 8;
00471                                 k = iarr[1];
00472                                 for (j=0; j<8; j++) {
00473                                         act_flystick[i].button[j] = k & 0x01;
00474                                         k >>= 1;
00475                                 }
00476                                 act_flystick[i].num_joystick = 2;  // additionally to buttons 5-8
00477                                 if (iarr[1] & 0x20) {
00478                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = -1;
00479                                 } else
00480                                 if (iarr[1] & 0x80) {
00481                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = 1;
00482                                 } else {
00483                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[0] = 0;
00484                                 }
00485                                 if(iarr[1] & 0x10){
00486                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = -1;
00487                                 }else if(iarr[1] & 0x40){
00488                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = 1;
00489                                 }else{
00490                                         act_flystick[i].joystick[1] = 0;
00491                                 }
00492                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].loc))) {
00493                                         return false;
00494                                 }
00495                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].rot))) {
00496                                         return false;
00497                                 }
00498                         }
00499                         continue;
00500                 }
00501 
00502                 // line for Flystick data (newer format):
00503                 if (!strncmp(s, "6df2 ", 5)) {
00504                         s += 5;
00505                         // get number of calibrated Flysticks
00506                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00507                                 return false;
00508                         }
00509                         // adjust length of vector
00510                         if (n != act_num_flystick) {
00511                                 act_flystick.resize(n);
00512                                 act_num_flystick = n;
00513                         }
00514                         // get number of Flysticks
00515                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00516                                 return false;
00517                         }
00518                         // get data of Flysticks
00519                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00520                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idii", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00521                                         return false;
00522                                 }
00523                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {  // not expected
00524                                         return false;
00525                                 }
00526                                 act_flystick[i].id = iarr[0];
00527                                 act_flystick[i].quality = d;
00528                                 if ((iarr[1] > DTRACK_FLYSTICK_MAX_BUTTON)||(iarr[1] > DTRACK_FLYSTICK_MAX_JOYSTICK)) {
00529                                         return false;
00530                                 }
00531                                 act_flystick[i].num_button = iarr[1];
00532                                 act_flystick[i].num_joystick = iarr[2];
00533                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].loc))){
00534                                         return false;
00535                                 }
00536                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_flystick[i].rot))){
00537                                         return false;
00538                                 }
00539                                 strcpy(sfmt, "");
00540                                 j = 0;
00541                                 while (j < act_flystick[i].num_button) {
00542                                         strcat(sfmt, "i");
00543                                         j += 32;
00544                                 }
00545                                 j = 0;
00546                                 while (j < act_flystick[i].num_joystick) {
00547                                         strcat(sfmt, "d");
00548                                         j++;
00549                                 }
00550                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, sfmt, iarr, NULL, act_flystick[i].joystick))) {
00551                                         return false;
00552                                 }
00553                                 k = l = 0;
00554                                 for (j=0; j<act_flystick[i].num_button; j++) {
00555                                         act_flystick[i].button[j] = iarr[k] & 0x01;
00556                                         iarr[k] >>= 1;
00557                                         l++;
00558                                         if (l == 32) {
00559                                                 k++;
00560                                                 l = 0;
00561                                         }
00562                                 }
00563                         }
00564                         continue;
00565                 }
00566 
00567                 // line for measurement tool data:
00568                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dmt ", 5)) {
00569                         s += 5;
00570                         // get number of calibrated measurement tools
00571                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00572                                 return false;
00573                         }
00574                         loc_num_meatool = n;
00575                         // adjust length of vector
00576                         if (n != act_num_meatool) {
00577                                 act_meatool.resize(n);
00578                                 act_num_meatool = n;
00579                         }
00580                         // get data of measurement tools
00581                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00582                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idi", iarr, NULL, &d))) {
00583                                         return false;
00584                                 }
00585                                 if (iarr[0] != i) {  // not expected
00586                                         return false;
00587                                 }
00588                                 act_meatool[i].id = iarr[0];
00589                                 act_meatool[i].quality = d;
00590                                 act_meatool[i].num_button = 1;
00591                                 act_meatool[i].button[0] = iarr[1] & 0x01;
00592                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_meatool[i].loc))) {
00593                                         return false;
00594                                 }
00595                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_meatool[i].rot))) {
00596                                         return false;
00597                                 }
00598                         }
00599                         continue;
00600                 }
00601 
00602                 // line for measurement reference data:
00603                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dmtr ", 6)) {
00604                         s += 6;
00605                         // get number of measurement references
00606                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00607                                 return false;
00608                         }
00609                         // get number of calibrated measurement references
00610                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00611                                 return false;
00612                         }
00613                         // adjust length of vector
00614                         if (n != act_num_mearef) {
00615                                 act_mearef.resize(n);
00616                                 act_num_mearef = n;
00617                         }
00618 
00619                         // get data of measurement references
00620                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00621                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &id, NULL, &d))) {
00622                                         return false;
00623                                 }
00624                                 act_mearef[i].id = id;
00625                                 act_mearef[i].quality = d;
00626                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_mearef[i].loc))) {
00627                                         return false;
00628                                 }
00629                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_mearef[i].rot))) {
00630                                         return false;
00631                                 }
00632                         }
00633                         continue;
00634                 }
00635 
00636                 // line for additional information about number of calibrated Fingertracking hands:
00637                 if (!strncmp(s, "glcal ", 6)) {
00638                         s += 6;
00639                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &loc_num_handcal))) { // get number of calibrated hands
00640                                 return false;
00641                         }
00642                 }
00643 
00644                 // line for A.R.T. Fingertracking hand data:
00645                 if (!strncmp(s, "gl ", 3)) {
00646                         s += 3;
00647                         // disable all existing data
00648                         for (i=0; i<act_num_hand; i++) {
00649                                 memset(&act_hand[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00650                                 act_hand[i].id = i;
00651                                 act_hand[i].quality = -1;
00652                         }
00653                         // get number of hands (in line)
00654                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) {
00655                                 return false;
00656                         }
00657                         // get data of hands
00658                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00659                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "idii", iarr, NULL, &d))){
00660                                         return false;
00661                                 }
00662                                 id = iarr[0];
00663                                 if (id >= act_num_hand) {  // adjust length of vector
00664                                         act_hand.resize(id + 1);
00665                                         for (j=act_num_hand; j<=id; j++) {
00666                                                 memset(&act_hand[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00667                                                 act_hand[j].id = j;
00668                                                 act_hand[j].quality = -1;
00669                                         }
00670                                         act_num_hand = id + 1;
00671                                 }
00672                                 act_hand[id].id = iarr[0];
00673                                 act_hand[id].lr = iarr[1];
00674                                 act_hand[id].quality = d;
00675                                 if (iarr[2] > DTRACK_HAND_MAX_FINGER) {
00676                                         return false;
00677                                 }
00678                                 act_hand[id].nfinger = iarr[2];
00679                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].loc))) {
00680                                         return false;
00681 
00682                                 }
00683                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].rot))){
00684                                         return false;
00685                                 }
00686                                 // get data of fingers
00687                                 for (j = 0; j < act_hand[id].nfinger; j++) {
00688                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].finger[j].loc))) {
00689                                                 return false;
00690                                         }
00691                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_hand[id].finger[j].rot))){
00692                                                 return false;
00693                                         }
00694                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "dddddd", NULL, NULL, darr))){
00695                                                 return false;
00696                                         }
00697                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].radiustip = darr[0];
00698                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[0] = darr[1];
00699                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].anglephalanx[0] = darr[2];
00700                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[1] = darr[3];
00701                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].anglephalanx[1] = darr[4];
00702                                         act_hand[id].finger[j].lengthphalanx[2] = darr[5];
00703                                 }
00704                         }
00705                         continue;
00706                 }
00707 
00708                 // line for 6dj human model data
00709                 if (!strncmp(s, "6dj ", 4)) {
00710                         s += 4;
00711 
00712                         // get number of calibrated human models
00713                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) { 
00714                                 return false;    
00715                         }
00716                         // adjust length of vector
00717                         if(n != act_num_human){
00718                                 act_human.resize(n);
00719                                 act_num_human = n;
00720                         }
00721                         for(i=0; i<act_num_human; i++){
00722                                 memset(&act_human[i], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Human_Type));
00723                                 act_human[i].id = i;
00724                                 act_human[i].num_joints = 0;
00725                         }
00726                         
00727                         // get number of human models
00728                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &n))) { 
00729                                 return false;
00730                         }
00731                         int id_human;
00732                         for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00733                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ii", iarr, NULL,NULL))){
00734                                         return false;
00735                                 }
00736                                 if (iarr[0] > act_num_human - 1) // not expected
00737                                         return false;
00738 
00739                                 id_human = iarr[0];
00740                                 act_human[id_human].id = iarr[0];
00741                                 act_human[id_human].num_joints = iarr[1];
00742 
00743                                 for (j = 0; j < iarr[1]; j++){
00744                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &id, NULL, &d))){
00745                                                 return false;
00746                                         }
00747                                         act_human[id_human].joint[j].id = id;
00748                                         act_human[id_human].joint[j].quality = d;
00749 
00750                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "dddddd", NULL, NULL, darr))){
00751                                                 return false;
00752                                         }
00753                                         memcpy(act_human[id_human].joint[j].loc, &darr,  3*sizeof(double));
00754                                         memcpy(act_human[id_human].joint[j].ang, &darr[3],  3*sizeof(double));
00755 
00756                                         if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddddddddd", NULL, NULL, act_human[id_human].joint[j].rot))){
00757                                                 return false;
00758                                         }
00759                                 }
00760                         }
00761                         continue;
00762                 }
00763 
00764                 // line for single marker data:
00765                 if (!strncmp(s, "3d ", 3)) {
00766                         s += 3;
00767                         // get number of markers
00768                         if (!(s = string_get_i(s, &act_num_marker))) {
00769                                 act_num_marker = 0;
00770                                 return false;
00771                         }
00772                         if (act_num_marker > (int )act_marker.size()) {
00773                                 act_marker.resize(act_num_marker);
00774                         }
00775                         // get data of single markers
00776                         for (i=0; i<act_num_marker; i++) {
00777                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "id", &act_marker[i].id, NULL, &act_marker[i].quality))) {
00778                                         return false;
00779                                 }
00780                                 if (!(s = string_get_block(s, "ddd", NULL, NULL, act_marker[i].loc))) {
00781                                         return false;
00782                                 }
00783                         }
00784                         continue;
00785                 }
00786 
00787                 // ignore unknown line identifiers (could be valid in future DTracks)
00788         } while((s = string_nextline(d_udpbuf, s, d_udpbufsize)));
00789 
00790         // set number of calibrated standard bodies, if necessary:
00791         if (loc_num_bodycal >= 0) {     // '6dcal' information was available
00792                 n = loc_num_bodycal - loc_num_flystick1 - loc_num_meatool;
00793                 if (n > act_num_body) {  // adjust length of vector
00794                         act_body.resize(n);
00795                         for (j=act_num_body; j<n; j++) {
00796                                 memset(&act_body[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Body_Type));
00797                                 act_body[j].id = j;
00798                                 act_body[j].quality = -1;
00799                         }
00800                 }
00801                 act_num_body = n;
00802         }
00803 
00804         // set number of calibrated Fingertracking hands, if necessary:
00805         if (loc_num_handcal >= 0) {  // 'glcal' information was available
00806                 if (loc_num_handcal > act_num_hand) {  // adjust length of vector
00807                         act_hand.resize(loc_num_handcal);
00808                         for (j=act_num_hand; j<loc_num_handcal; j++) {
00809                                 memset(&act_hand[j], 0, sizeof(DTrack_Hand_Type));
00810                                 act_hand[j].id = j;
00811                                 act_hand[j].quality = -1;
00812                         }
00813                 }
00814                 act_num_hand = loc_num_handcal;
00815         }
00816 
00817         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
00818         return true;
00819 }
00820

01033 
01034 
01042 bool DTrackSDK::sendCommand(const std::string command)
01043 {
01044         if (!isLocalDataPortValid())
01045                 return false;
01046         lastDataError = ERR_NONE;
01047         // dest is dtrack2
01048         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK_2)     {
01049                 // command style is dtrack?
01050                 if (0 == strncmp(command.c_str(), "dtrack ", 7)) {
01051                         std::string c = command.substr(7);
01052                         // start measurement
01053                         if (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 3",4)) {
01054                                 return startMeasurement();
01055                         }
01056                         // stop measurement
01057                         if (    (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 0",4))
01058                                 ||      (0 == strncmp(c.c_str(), "10 1",4)))
01059                         {
01060                                 return stopMeasurement();
01061                         }
01062                         // simulate success of other old commands
01063                         return true;
01064                 }
01065         }
01066         if (udp_send(d_udpsock, (void*)command.c_str(), (unsigned int)command.length() + 1, d_remote_ip, d_remoteport, d_udptimeout_us))
01067         {
01068                 lastDataError = ERR_NET;
01069                 return false;
01070         }
01071         if (strcmp(command.c_str(), "dtrack 10 3") == 0) {
01072         #ifdef OS_UNIX
01073                 sleep(1);     // some delay (actually only necessary for older DTrack versions...)
01074         #endif
01075         #ifdef OS_WIN
01076                 Sleep(1000);  // some delay (actually only necessary for older DTrack versions...)
01077         #endif
01078         }
01079         return true;
01080 }
01081 
01082 
01097 int DTrackSDK::sendDTrack2Command(const std::string command, std::string *answer)
01098 {
01099         // Params via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01100         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01101                 return -2;
01102 
01103         // reset dtrack error
01104         setLastDTrackError();
01105 
01106         // command too long?
01107         if (command.length() > DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN) {
01108                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01109                 return -3;
01110         }
01111 
01112         // connection invalid
01113         if (!isCommandInterfaceValid()) {
01114                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01115                 return -10;
01116         }
01117 
01118         // send TCP command string:
01119         if ((tcp_send(d_tcpsock, command.c_str(), command.length() + 1, d_tcptimeout_us))) {
01120                 lastServerError = ERR_NET;
01121                 return -11;
01122         }
01123 
01124         // receive TCP response string:
01125         char ans[DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN];
01126         int err;
01127         if ((err = tcp_receive(d_tcpsock, ans, DTRACK_PROT_MAXLEN, d_tcptimeout_us)) < 0) {
01128 
01129                 if (err == -1) {        // timeout
01130                         lastServerError = ERR_TIMEOUT;
01131                 }
01132                 else
01133                 if (err == -9) {        // broken connection
01134                         tcp_exit(d_tcpsock);
01135                         d_tcpsock = NULL;
01136                 }
01137                 else
01138                         lastServerError = ERR_NET;      // network error
01139 
01140                 if (answer)
01141                         *answer = "";
01142 
01143                 return err;
01144         }
01145 
01146         // parse answer:
01147 
01148         // check for "dtrack2 ok" / no error
01149         if (0 == strcmp(ans, "dtrack2 ok"))
01150                 return 1;
01151 
01152         // got error msg?
01153         if (0 == strncmp(ans, "dtrack2 err ", 12)) {
01154                 char *s = ans + 12;
01155                 int i;
01156 
01157                 // parse error code
01158                 if (!(s = string_get_i((char *)s, &i))) {
01159                         setLastDTrackError(-1100, "SDK error -1100");
01160                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01161                         return -1100;
01162                 }
01163                 lastDTrackError = i;
01164 
01165                 // parse error string
01166                 if (!(s = string_get_quoted_text((char *)s, lastDTrackErrorString))) {
01167                         setLastDTrackError(-1100, "SDK error -1100");
01168                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01169                         return -1101;
01170                 }
01171 
01172                 return 2;
01173         }
01174 
01175         // not 'dtrack2 ok'/'dtrack2 err ..' -> return msg
01176         if (answer)
01177                 *answer = ans;
01178 
01179         lastServerError = ERR_NONE;
01180         return 0;
01181 }

01194         return setParam(category + " " + name + " " + value);

01197 
01204 bool DTrackSDK::setParam(const std::string parameter)
01205 {
01206         // send command, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01207         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 set " + parameter));
01208 }

01210 
01219 bool DTrackSDK::getParam(const std::string category, const std::string name, std::string& value)
01220 {
01221         return getParam(category + " " + name, value);
01222 }
01223 
01224 
01232 bool DTrackSDK::getParam(const std::string parameter, std::string& value)
01233 {
01234         // Params via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01235         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01236                 return false;
01237 
01238         std::string res;
01239         // expected answer is "dtrack2 set" -> return value 0
01240         if (0 != sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 get " + parameter, &res))
01241                 return false;
01242 
01243         // parse parameter from answer
01244         if (0 == strncmp(res.c_str(), "dtrack2 set ", 12)) {
01245                 char *str = strdup(res.c_str() + 12);
01246                 char *s = str;
01247                 if (!(s = string_cmp_parameter(s, parameter.c_str()))) {
01248                         free(str);
01249                         lastServerError = ERR_PARSE;
01250                         return false;
01251                 }
01252 
01253                 // assign result
01254                 value = s;
01255                 free(str);
01256                 return true;
01257         }
01258 
01259         return false;
01260 }
01261 
01262 
01269 bool DTrackSDK::getMessage()
01270 {
01271         // Messages via TCP are not supported in DTrack
01272         if (rsType != SYS_DTRACK_2)
01273                 return false;
01274 
01275         // send request
01276         std::string res;
01277         if (0 != sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 getmsg", &res))
01278                 return false;
01279 
01280         // check answer
01281         if (0 != strncmp(res.c_str(), "dtrack2 msg ", 12))
01282                 return false;
01283 
01284         // reset values
01285         d_message_origin = d_message_msg = d_message_status = "";
01286         d_message_framenr = d_message_errorid = 0;
01287 
01288         // parse message
01289         const char* s = res.c_str() + 12;
01290         // get 'origin'
01291         if (!(s = string_get_word((char *)s, d_message_origin)))
01292                 return false;
01293 
01294         // get 'status'
01295         if (!(s = string_get_word((char *)s, d_message_status)))
01296                         return false;
01297 
01298         unsigned int ui;
01299         // get 'frame counter'
01300         if(!(s = string_get_ui((char *)s, &ui)))
01301                 return false;
01302         d_message_framenr = ui;
01303 
01304         // get 'error id'
01305         if(!(s = string_get_ui((char *)s, &ui)))
01306                 return false;
01307         d_message_errorid = ui;
01308 
01309         // get 'message'
01310         if(!(s = string_get_quoted_text((char *)s, d_message_msg)))
01311                 return false;
01312 
01313         return true;
01314 }

01380 
01381 
01388 bool DTrackSDK::startMeasurement()
01389 {
01390         // Check for special DTrack handling
01391         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK) {
01392                 return (sendCommand("dtrack 10 3")) && (sendCommand("dtrack 31"));
01393         }
01394 
01395         // start tracking, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01396         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 tracking start"));
01397 }
01398 
01399 
01405 bool DTrackSDK::stopMeasurement()
01406 {
01407         // Check for special DTrack handling
01408         if (rsType == SYS_DTRACK) {
01409                 return (sendCommand("dtrack 32")) && (sendCommand("dtrack 10 0"));
01410         }
01411 
01412         // stop tracking, 1 means answer "dtrack2 ok"
01413         return (1 == sendDTrack2Command("dtrack2 tracking stop"));
01414 }
